instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Fanspin and vcore but no boot
threads.message:
As the title says I get fanspin and it goes fast if i unplug the trackpad or boot in smc bypass but no chime or anything.
Vcore is at 1.153v, There is a little bit of corrosion arround the lvds connector but only a couple of feedback capacitors

Green light flashes until i press the power button then it stays steady

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Fanspin and vcore but no boot
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Fanspin and vcore but no boot
threads.message:
black on ground is 22.3k
red on ground is 7.79k

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Fanspin and vcore but no boot
threads.message: That is a bit on the low side :( I'm afraid this is a dead MCP.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Fanspin and vcore but no boot
threads.message: Ow, MCP is part of the processor right?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Fanspin and vcore but no boot
threads.message:
[QUOTE="PhilipC, post: 20714"]Ow, MCP is part of the processor right?[/QUOTE]

Nope, its the other big chip thats not the CPU. Multi Chip Package. Does stuff like usb, graphics, sata etc. Page 2 of schematic.

Anyway its game over for this board, as you'll not find a new MCP.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-b Fanspin and vcore but no boot
threads.message: Ow another one for the scrap pile, thanks for the insight
